title: [FR] Allow override of gunicorn app entrypoint for MLflow server

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.

### Proposal Summary

The MLflow server executes gunicorn with a hard-coded value `mlflow.server:app` ([reference](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/server/__init__.py#L106)) gunicorn application cli parameter. This prevents easy customization of the MLflow server Flask app i.e. adding `bofore_request` hooks.

### Motivation

> #### What is the use case for this feature?
The goal is adding a `before_request` hook to perform authorization by checking JWT authenication header provided by an AWS application load balancer 

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
In order to allow extra flexibility for self-hosted MLflow users to customize the mlflow Flask server with pre/post request hooks 

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?
This would simplify the logic for authorization of users of the MLflow server

> #### Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case?
Because MLflow server doesn't natively allow custom pre/post process  request hooks for the tracking  webserver component


### Details

It would be desirable that the aforementioned gunicorn app entrypoint can be overridden by a custom value (either via --gunicorn-opts or an additional `mlflow server` cli option)

Ideally one would be able to write a custom script as this:

```python
# customapp.py

from flask import request
from mlflow.server import app

@app.before_request
def hook():
    print(request.path)
```
and run:
`mlflow server ... --gunicorn-app customapp:app`
